articles.headline: G.O.P. Shift Is Seen on Trade
articles.snippet: The administration has signaled a new willingness to work with Democrats on three pending trade deals, with talk of labor rights guarantees.
articles.abstract: The administration has signaled a new willingness to work with Democrats on three pending trade deals, with talk of labor rights guarantees.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 5 — When the Democrats swept to victory last fall, after a campaign fueled partly by attacks on President Bush’s trade policies, trade deals promoted by the administration seemed doomed in the new Congress. But that was then.

articles.headline: Equity Firm Attracted to Attractions
articles.snippet: The Blackstone Group agreed to buy the Tussauds Group, owner of the Madame Tussauds wax museums, for $1.9 billion in cash.
articles.abstract: The Blackstone Group agreed to buy the Tussauds Group, owner of the Madame Tussauds wax museums, for $1.9 billion in cash.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON, March 5 — The Blackstone Group agreed on Monday to buy the Tussauds Group, owner of the Madame Tussauds wax museums, for £1 billion ($1.9 billion) in cash.

articles.headline: Broadcasters Agree to Fine Over Payoffs
articles.snippet: Four large radio station owners agreed to pay $12.5 million to resolve claims that they accepted cash in exchange for playing songs.
articles.abstract: Four large radio station owners agreed to pay $12.5 million to resolve claims that they accepted cash in exchange for playing songs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Radio broadcasters have long been accused of corrupting the public airwaves by accepting bribes from corporate music giants.

articles.headline: For Sex Offenders, a Dispute Over Therapy’s Benefits
articles.snippet: There is no convincing evidence that treatment plans are effective in reforming offenders.
articles.abstract: There is no convincing evidence that treatment plans are effective in reforming offenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATASCADERO, Calif. — During five years of psychotherapy at a treatment center here for sex offenders who have finished their prison terms, Bill Price, a pedophile who admits to 21 victims as young as 3, has constructed a painstaking plan for staying straight.
articles.byline: By Abby Goodnough and Monica Davey

articles.headline: Wal-Mart Says Worker Taped Reporter’s Calls
articles.snippet: A computer systems technician secretly taped calls with a reporter for The Times, a spokeswoman said.
articles.abstract: A computer systems technician secretly taped calls with a reporter for The Times, a spokeswoman said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal investigators are looking into the actions of a computer systems technician at Wal-Mart Stores who, over a period of several months, intercepted pager and text messages and also secretly taped telephone conversations between Wal-Mart employees and a reporter for The New York Times, the company said yesterday.

articles.headline: Bush to Set Out Shift in Agenda on Latin Trip
articles.snippet: The president will introduce plans to cut poverty and create jobs in Latin America, where anti-U.S. sentiment has grown.
articles.abstract: The president will introduce plans to cut poverty and create jobs in Latin America, where anti-U.S. sentiment has grown.
articles.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil, March 5 — President Bush arrives here on Thursday with an energy partnership plan to create jobs and decrease poverty and inequality, a marked shift in Washington’s priorities for Latin America aimed at countering the challenge posed by President Hugo Chávez of Venezuela.

articles.headline: Dollars to Spare in China’s Trove
articles.snippet: Pressure is growing on Beijing’s financial leaders to tap their foreign exchange reserves for social spending.
articles.abstract: Pressure is growing on Beijing’s financial leaders to tap their foreign exchange reserves for social spending.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG, March 3 — In the insular world of China’s central bank they are known as the Three Xiaos, three women with similar names who oversee the greatest fortune ever assembled: China’s more than $1 trillion in foreign exchange reserves.

articles.headline: Clinton Shapes Her Image for ’08 Race
articles.snippet: In the cliché of modern politics, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton is “reintroducing herself to the American people.”
articles.abstract: In the cliché of modern politics, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton is “reintroducing herself to the American people.”
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, N.H. — Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton signs autographs meticulously, drawing out each line and curve of “H-i-l-l-a-r-y,” “R-o-d-h-a-m” and “C-l-i-n-t-o-n.” She leaves no stray lines or wayward marks.
